title: Odd "3"
content:
I'm looking for any fonts that match the "3" in this image - I can't seem to find any with a 3 like this...   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826041018im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26031.jpg)
author: toketsu

comments.content:
Uh, just have in mind that that glyph is not a 3, nor a z.   
It's an IPA character (I recall Bringhurst says something about it on 'Elements').   
You can find that glyph in IPA fonts (there are some free IPA fonts available from [SIL](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826041018/http:/www.sil.org/computing/catalog/show_software.asp?id=12)).
[Paralucent](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826041018/http:/www.veer.com/results.asp?image=DET0000198) has the angular top to the 3, with lining numerals.
